humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the gross tumor size as 4.1 x 2.6 x 4.0 cm. Using the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for breast cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the size of the tumor is given as 4.1 x 2.6 x 4.0 cm (grossly) and the size of the invasive component is also 4.1 cm. According to the TNM staging system for breast cancer, a T2 stage is defined as a tumor that is greater than 2 cm in size but not greater than 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
